ratings.comment: Prof Seo is one of my favorite professors I have had so far. He truly loves what he teaches and you can see that through his lectures. He also cares about his students success and is always accessible outside of class to explain thoroughly any lectures or concepts you didn't understand.

Professor Sang was one of the best professors I have ever had. He is very caring and wants every student to succeed. He is incredibly intelligent, but teaches his material in a way that makes it very clear and understanding. Highly recommend taking this class, one of my favorite classes as he made challenging lecture material very engaging.

Sang is my favorite professor I've had this far at UW-Madison. This guy is not only a genius, but is also super funny and caring towards all students. Exams are super fair, and if you pay attention in class, you will do very well on all of them. I can't recommend this guy enough

Prof. Seo is a very friendly and caring person and a fantastic professor. I enjoy his office hour. The course material is concept-heavy, and it takes you some time to review before each exam. Overall, it's not difficult and once you go to the lectures and read though the slides, you will be fine. The third exam is more difficult than the first two.

While his lectures can be a little boring (in depth on easy concepts), he is a really caring guy with interesting experience in industry. You can tell he really enjoys the content. The exams feature only content covered in his lecture slides, so studying is easy. Graded by three exams (which he allows one note sheet for) and six problem sets.

Sang is a fantastic professor and one of the best I have had at UW. His lectures are in-depth and he is very knowledgeable about all of the topics. He cares about his students. The tests are very straightforward and are straight off of lecture material. Very exam heavy, but allows a cheat sheet and are easy with a little studying. I recommend him!

Sang is one of the best professors I've had. The tests are very straightforward and Sang's lectures are interesting as he applies his experiences in the financial world to class concepts. He is very accessible outside of class and responds to emails quickly. You don't have to put in a ton of effort studying since will learn a lot from his lectures.

Professor Sang Seo is one of the best professors I had in college. He has a very clear and logical structure for his lecture contents and explains the concepts very well. The exams are purely based on the lecture content and problem sets. He is also very willing to answer students questions in office hour. Would strongly recommend taking his class.
